SENT.plain: Signs and symptoms of pseudotumor cerebri include papilledema with imaging studies that reveal a normal brain; elevated intracranial pressure with normal cerebrospinal fluid contents; and abducens palsies with diplopia
The most common presenting symptom is headache
Infants often are sleepy or apathetic
Other symptoms include dizziness and ataxia
Loss of acuity or visual field is the only serious permanent complication of pseudotumor cerebri; children often complain of "blurred vision."
